positive.review:
I brought this game around the time it released, only because a few others in my class at Uni had been doing so. Since then I have opened it just about every time I have worked on assignments, I have got every achievement, and reached level 174 in game. As I am writing this I have just submitted the last assessment for my degree, with 1830 hours in this game.

This productivity tool has helped me so much through all of my studies, using the checklists, stopwatch, and journal, as well as just to have a comforting scene running on a different monitor to help ease some stress. The game offers plenty of customisation, which only gets better with every update, allowing you to create the perfect cozy space for you and your lofi avatar. I lastly want to note the developers, as they're amazing too! Always listening to feedback, and making the best decisions when it comes to DLC, payments, and new content. I hope they are all really proud of what they have created.

10/10

As someone who suffers from chronic illness/autoimmune condition, and frequent mental exhaustion... this game is quite literally my lifesaver. Having the soothing sound of lo-fi music with white noise play in the background while I tend to my daily tasks makes the overwhelm of daily life so much more tolerable. I love the Homework Radio and Lofi Girl playlists! Normally, even just thinking about doing my chores would paralyze me with fear and stress. With the tools in this game, I don't feel stress nearly as much as I used to.

There is a journal, a timer, a habit tracker, and a to-do list setting all conveniently placed in the game. The UI is so pretty, and seems methodically implemented. I never have any issues with the way the game is designed. Everything functions the way it should. I've tried other productivity games before, and they were all so buggy and messy. I never have those problems here.

Spirit City Lofi Sessions has genuinely improved my productivity ever since I got it. Thanks to this game, I have come to the point where I look forward to starting my day instead of dreading it. And that is a *huge* deal for someone like me. I can't recommend this game enough.

10/10, and I give this rating with so much love and adoration. Game devs, I hope your food is always delicious and that the weather is always perfect for you, thank you for making this game <3

Firstly, my rating: 5/5 â­

This lovely gem of a tool also got an update, so I wanted to also recommend this one. 

Spirit City is partly a game, partly a productivity tool and it does both very well. This game gets updates fairly often, and the DLCs are quite reasonably priced. You can decorate your character's space (home and now a train) and your character as well as their spirit companion. There is also a journal, timer and to do list for all of your organization needs. They have vastly improved how these work in recent updates, and they also changed the UI quite a bit. In this last update, they also included the ability to change the color of the UI as well so it blends better with the look you're trying to achieve. All around? Fantastic. 

I do wish there were more eye/face options, but it appears those are in the works via the most recent update. I also kind of hate that the esc key now doesn't leave the current menu you're in, it will immediately just give you a pop-up asking if you want to quit out of the game entirely... but that's a minor and petty annoyance and not really a criticism of the devs. I'm sure there is also a way to probably change the key on that, I just haven't looked for it yet. The game has also crashed more on me now within the last two updates than it ever did in the past, but I'm sure that will get hotfixed since the new patch just came out. All very minor complaints, and nothing that has hindered my enjoyment too much. 

I've played other similar game/tools and they just don't have the same cozy feeling that this one evokes, they've really done a great job at dominating the niche that this game/tool resides in. No one else has done it quite the same way, and I haven't lost interest in this game like I have the others. So, well done. I'm excited to see what the future holds for Spirit City.

Extremely useful focus tool, does pretty much everything I want a focus tool to do and more. The music selection is phenomenal, the game's aesthetics makes it stupid easy to just put the game in full screen and focus on other stuff.

My only complaint is that there is no mobile version of the game yet, and there's no way to add in player-created models. I think if those 2 things were added it'd really take the game into the next level in terms of focus (having the game play on a phone while I focus on other stuff on my computer so I always have knowledge on what tasks I'm working on and how much time I have left) and in terms of enjoyment (I'm certain that people can make absolutely bonkers decorations and player models if we were allowed to put them into the game.)

Spirit City: Lofi Sessions is a refreshing blend of relaxation and productivity, offering a gamified focus tool set to a calming lofi soundtrack. Designed to help players stay organized and stress-free the game provides a great balance of motivation and calm, making it a good game for those needing an extra focus or a peaceful escape.

The game allows for deep customization, from decorating your cozy space to collecting cute spirits, all while being immersed in soothing ambient sounds. It's clear that the developers poured true care into creating not just a tool for focus, but a comforting, rewarding experience.

What keeps me playing, or rather utilizing this game, is the robust sound effects. I like and listen to lofi, but often I need to concentrate more with no music or I want to listen to my own music, so in the past I've used various websites or YT to play sound effects. I've pretty much switched entirely over to this game!

This game has lots of sound effects, from city and forest, pink and white noise, or just good rain and snow, even background chatter or food cooking, and the sound effects are great! I haven't been distracted by repeating effects yet. I actually bought this game for  friend just based on how solid the sound effects are!

There is gamified to do lists and timers and a lovely journal, to say nothing of exploring the space with the cute spirits you can find. I made myself and find myself knitting or sipping tea in various space in game while IRL I do other things. 

Overall this is a wonderful game. I've found no bugs or anything that has been negative about it tbqh, while I've only got around 8hrs in game I can see this being something I play for many years to come! <3
The definition of chill and relax game. The background music, the sounds, stuff, everything makes you feel relaxed. Everyone can just afk on this after a stressful day!
I really like just leaving it in the background while I do other stuff in my office. As long as they keep improving it and adding new stuff, I'm probably going to stick to it for a long time.

I have tried a range of "productivity" games, and they all have their strengths and weaknesses, so whether any given one will be good for you depends on what you need/want. 

Spirit City has a great built-in ambient noise selection, the aesthetic is super cute, there is a lot to customize, and I love the spirits themselves. It functions best as a body-doubling tool and soundtrack in my experience. It is simply enjoyable to have it up on my second monitor to look at, as well, and the system for unlocking more spirits does encourage long periods of "play." I also love the expansions (yay trains!!).

On the less positive side (depending on what you're looking for), I do not find the built-in productivity tools to be enjoyable or worth using. There is a timer, a to-do list, and a journal, but I rarely use them. They give meager rewards for use and I don't enjoy how they look or function, personally. I think there are MUCH better implementations of the pomodoro method, for example, like PomoFarm. So, if you're looking for a game that keeps you on track to maximize productivity, I would not say Spirit City is that. And honestly, the currency takes a long time to earn and when I run out of new Spirits to unlock I find it harder to motivate to play for long periods.

Overall, I do really recommend this game! I love designing my rooms/trains and dressing up my characters, but just be aware it is more vibes rather than a direct productivity = reward system.

PLEASE add an advanced visual feature to add things like dust particles, lighting hues (not times), etc. While I love the vibes I would love it even more if we were able to tinker with the vibes beyond time and accessories.
Beautiful game and actually does help me with productivity!

This is my first time purchasing a productivity app and I have to say that my purchase is very worth it. I did not expect to be this much fulfilling especially when you really want to lock in. Graphics, interface, productivity, and aesthetic wise <333 I can see myself using the Steam from time to time because of this. Thank you for this app that I get to use everyday for my tasks. LOVED IT SO MUCH!

Absolutely adore this game! It keeps me locked in and motivated to complete all my tasks! The different scenery and all of the sounds, absolutely adore it! 11/10 game!
Amazing! Updates and more great for relaxing and more.

Whether you want something to focus with, relax to, or just vibe with, this is one of the best chill games on Steam. Definitely worth it. ðŸŽ§ðŸ’«

Only drawback was that it consumes the GPU resources a lot when I was running with the epic graphics options, 1280x720, and 60fps. So I set the 'target frame rate - unfocused' to 5 fps. It's okay unless the train is moving.

I love Spirit City in the background while I do other things. It's calming and adorable and the audio helps me focus on things that I need to get done. A+, worth every cent, keeps getting better with every update.

Spirit City is a gamified focus tool with chill tunes. It has the basics (to-do list, timer, habit tracker, etc.), but it also has extras (music, sounds, decor, customizable avatar, etc.) that keep things fun and fresh. It consistently received hotfixes and updates. Both free and paid content have come out in the meantime.

There are plenty of spirit companions to discover over time, and they're all quite cute. Customizing your avatar and decorating your room are also nice additions, personalizing your experience. You can adjust the sound, lighting, and more to suit your taste. It's overall a great tool to help you focus on daily tasks.

[h3]If you're someone who started with the Finch app like me, you'll adore this[/h3]

Journaling, to-do check lists, wellness timers, weekly calendar, music playlists you can customise, pro-accessibility and equality, lots of vines and fairy lights (very important), and even seasonal decor for those into that!

Audiophiles rejoice, you can give your ears everything from stormy days to crackly fire and vinyl or the distant chatter of folk in a sizzling and bubbling kitchen, all while partaking in copyright-safe jams & cute animations of your current activity with a lil critter friend :) I do wish there was more interactivity we could have with that lil fella tho

The customizability of everything is through the roof, it uses lofi tracks from one of my favorite channels Homework Radio, The UI is intuitive and easy to navigate especially after the recent update, and it's actually helped keep me on track with my daily tasks. The rewards and lelveling up seems fairly balanced and you'll love figuring out how each spirit appears by it's hint. My favorite spirit is Votodo. The one thing is I would like the spirits to do more of the activities with you. Some of the spirits recycle animations between activities like sometimes just stand there idle. Though with updates I've been noticing more interactability with them so I think this is a work in progress. Overall highly reccomend this game.
I love it so much. When I'm writing, or just need to chill this is it. I can't explain it in words, ironically. It's a piece of beauty, of piece and of sanctuary. You'll enjoy it, trust me.

I love that the game has helped my concentrate more. Although, I'm not happy with the newest update. The dresses are so ugly. It was like the dev did not run this past anyone before they released it. I was highly disappointed. I'm also not a fan of their discord server. I expressed my opinion of the newest update and found myself banned. By the way, I did not argue or make any other statement. Nor did I break any rules or TOU. So I won't be purchasing any more DLC. But I enjoyed the game.

As you can see from my play time, I always have this game running. I find the incremental timers keep me grounded and really help with having my daily chore checklist readily available. Has tons of content to unlock too, and even with it all unlocked in the main game, it is just convenient to have running. Cool low vibe tracks too. Anyone on the spectrum would really benefit from having this game. It takes a bit to make it a habit, but once you do, you'll find yourself feeling lost without running it. I can't recommend this enough!

It is its own little universe, a place where you may build your own virtual safe haven, that can help you body doubling and "gamifying" things that can be tougher to tackle, aiding to selfcare in many instances (from things we forget, or adding some order to such an ever-growing list, to feeling some company mid-task or mid-pause) ...but, eloquently, it is also its own universe outside of the game, within the Community that exists around the Dev Team, with many events, a lot of love towards artists of all pen-strokes of life, who will enthusiastically get rewarded, seen and celebrated, for their effort and imagination! I haven't even customized anything in the room but if you're into home design you'll probably like that. I've mainly switched out my spirit and changed my clothes a bit.

It's great for every age wether it's for school, uni, work, free time, hobbies or else! 10/10 recommended!!!

I like this game (software) a lot.
As a AuDHD I have problems focusing from time to time, so body doubling is a good place to go. However, unfamiliar people give me too much pressure. In this game I am able to create an avatar as an alternate self, which takes away the pressure of being watched.
There are a wide range of activities I can choose from, which is also a plus. I do crocheting a lot and not many this kind of games allow me to work with yarn.
Sure the visuals are not my favorite style, but in this game it works. It ensures the balance between graphics and playability. I lowered the graphics display a bit, so the game can run for several hours on my laptop without needing a power cord. 
I don't real care about leveling up or pets, but it should be motivating for most. 
I'm thinking it might be helpful if people can play with several friends together (though I don't have any friends who can play with now).
Great cozy game! I love the spirits and how they can do tasks with me. The updates and DLC never disappoint and I enjoy decorating my room for different seasons and holidays!
A cozy little game to accompany you on your assignments or work~

The art style is really cute and the game manages to be fun without crossing into becoming distracting. Each update brings a lot of new content, and I love how the updates feel like seasonal events. The timer and to-do list are really useful features for those of us who use the pomodoro method.

Helped me get through the long hard days when assignments are piling up and there is only one week left for submission. The game has a couple of neat features that boosts productivity, but what does it for me is seeing the character zoned in on the task at hand and the cute spirits chilling on the side. Highly recommend it!

This game literally got me through my PhD writing phase in final year. The music is beautiful, soothing and excellent for focus. Clicking off the completed tasks helped me stay focused, get the dopamine rush of ticking off a task and also motivated me to continue! I could take a break and customise my character, which was amazing!

I actually mentioned this game in the acknowledgement section of my thesis, this is how important this game is to me and how much of a positive impact it had in task management. I likely have ADHD, with autism lol, and it is crazy good how much this game gripped me and kept me on the right trajectory.

The spirit companions are so adorable, but sometimes I wish we could have multiple at once!

But seriously, if you're struggling with keeping on top of tasks, remembering tasks and motivating yourself to do tasks, then this game is a game changer and lifesaver! Thank you so much for making this game :) 

I'm now going to prep for my Viva (or defence, for those who use that term) and this game is going to get me through the process I am CERTAIN :) 

PS: It's also great for chores and housework

Spirit City is a jack-of-all-trades study game that does well in every feature you could need in a comfy study timer and companion with a really affordable price for the base game. You can customise your character, your room, use your timer, take notes and make to-do lists and diary entries. Character and room customisation is a fairly new concept for study programs that this game has brought to pc for the first time, but with the other features listed, theyâ€™re standard and available in pretty much any study program. Spirit Cityâ€™s unique aspect is its creature collection system which lets you collect many different critters, with LOTS more being available in DLCs. Nearly everyone can find a spirit that meshes with their vibe, I kinda couldnâ€™t but I appreciate the companionship of my amogus nonetheless. If you ever wanted to collect funnee animals while getting work done, then youâ€™ll enjoy this. It isnâ€™t really my jam and I kinda treat collecting them as a chore, but it's nice to see what new spirit designs the dev team comes up with.

So these things are all well and good, but Iâ€™ll be ignoring the note, diary, calendar and to-do features of this game and any other games I mention going forward, as there are better, more integratable options out there that are superior in form and function to their game counterparts, like google calendar, todoist, notion, obsidian, etc. Iâ€™ll be looking at other aspects of the game, like style, models, atmosphere, ambience and stuff. 

The Spirit City team has put lots of effort in their QoL features, which is great and super nice of them, but I feel that their passion doesnâ€™t quite come through in their in-game character models and animation. The style direction of Spirit City is very cute, fantastical and floaty, which makes the game feel kinda juvenile. Not to say that people canâ€™t like that, I feel like it needs more depth to not appear as so. Like Iâ€™m super into Slime Rancher but that game and its sequel have plenty of depth with its themes and relationships between the characters. Ways that Iâ€™m looking for this in a game without other characters or a progressive story are in facial expressions and subtle animations, thatâ€™s probably much because I understand that animating different expressions for each customisable feature would be super difficult, but without this your character feels much less like a character living and breathing in their world and more like a doll.

What I believe to be Spirit Cityâ€™s greatest feature that sets it apart from other games is the variety in environments that you can visit/set and do your junk in. With all the DLCs available right now, with the latest being All Aboard, you have the standard four places in your room, the kitchen, the dining table, the train carriage and balcony. Each of these places have a different vibe that can also be altered by your design sense (you can change the train carriage to resemble the inside of a spaceship!). The exterior scene of your room window and the train carriage can be changed to a lot of different settings, which is great and nice.

A drawback of Spirit Cityâ€™s room decoration system is that you canâ€™t place items wherever you want, you can choose what type you want and can change the colours on some of them, but the items are in fixed locations. You canâ€™t choose where the bed will be, which is understandable because itâ€™s an interactable setting, but you also canâ€™t change the location of other furniture, like side tables, or decorations like flower pots, mugs, etc. Maybe thereâ€™s a performance function for it?

Now Iâ€™ll talk about a few other games that do better in specific aspects that Spirit City doesnâ€™t do so well in. If you want a lighter study program that you can run on your laptop or weaker computer while using it, thereâ€™s ChillPulse. It has its drawbacks though, such as the less customisable rooms and characters. In Gogh, you can decorate your rooms however you want, being able to place objects anywhere and on anything. The character animations are similarly lacking (so it could be a limitation thing), but the style direction is very strong (which is also quite cute) so this is less obvious and impactful. In Chill With You, you donâ€™t have a customisable character at all, but you can study alongside the established character and chat between study or work sessions like theyâ€™re your study partner. With the subtle facial expressions and stretching animations like theyâ€™re really putting effort into their work, it feels prettyâ€¦ intricate, sorta? Like you know this person and youâ€™re working together to reach your individual goals.

All in all, Spirit City is a good study game that does well in all aspects, so itâ€™s good if you like it or donâ€™t know what exactly you want from your study game. It welcomes you into its colourful world where people study in their cozy rooms with their spirit buddies.

Cute graphics, relaxing, lots of soundtrack options, from rain to purring cat and warm fire.
I adore this game <3 I dont even know if I'd call it a game but, whatever it is, it's helped me start focusing on writing again.

This isn't really a "game" but more of a study tool. Spirit City has gotten me through many hours of studying late at night and chores during the day. Sometimes in between breaks I'll customize my character and the room before diving back into my personal hell of studying. Great little study tool!

This is a cute little productivity app and music player in one, with a creature collecting/decorating as a reward for doing things! I'm in the middle of a big writing project with a tight deadline, and this has helped me get a lot more done in a short time than I would have otherwise. While I like that this game let's you import your own music from your computer (if you want something other than the built in selection which is still solid honestly), it doesn't seem like you can make playlists without reorganizing your folders which is a bit of a bummer. 

Good customization options for character and room (multiple rooms if you get the dlcs), but wish there was the option of a rocking chair for the fireplace (because I have one irl from my late grandma and it's my cozy chair).

The music in this game is very relaxing, along with customizing different types of sounds and lighting to match the vibes. 

There's also a lot of fun interactive features to keep you entertained with the game. Even quests to level up.

Really worth the purchase, and helpful if you're into writing journals and having a set task list.

This game has accompanied me through my 5-month learning phase all the way to my graduation. I love it very much. It helped me take breaks in between, to drink some water and keep going consistently. Also for everyday things in the household I've really enjoyed using the To-Do List.
The game has a very appealing look to me and has definitely won a special place in my heart due to its rich detail. I'm really looking forward to more DLCs, because the ones we got are extraordinary awesome. I love that the devs actually listen to their community and update the game in our good. 

I would recommend this game to anybody, who struggles with building an own routine or continuity. It helped me a lot!

Honestly this game is just what I needed. I struggle to focus while studying and I am constantly shifting through lofi playlists to find the right vibe, but with this game, I can curate the vibe to exactly what I need to focus. The spirits themselves are adorable, and curating the vibe to what the spirit prompt suggests is such a cool feature that you can continue to study with while waiting for the spirit to show. I love this game and I can't wait to see what future updates bring :)

The best one of these productivity games I've tried!

PROS:

Youtube Integration:
I typically listents to very aggressive, doof doof screachy noises of the harddance subgenres while I work. 
I refrained from buying this game sooner because I rarely listen to, or enjoy Lofi. I much prefer the higher BPM sounds to make the ears bleed and brain go brrr. So it's great I have that option in-game. I just wish there was also Spotify integration.

Most "core features" unlocked from the start:
Some of the other games of this variety I've tried lock certain things like locations, time of day, and ambient noises behind levelling. This game does not. Nothing is locked behind levelling up. Gaining levels only grants you "Spirit Credits" that you use to purchase additional customizations.

Loads of customization options!!!


CONS: 

Distracting with the whole levelling up mechanics and using "Spirit Credits" to purchase decorations:
If you're very much ADHD, this may not be the best idle game to get shit done unless you want to get distracted every so often spending your freshly earned Spirit Credits purchasing decorations. 

No way to filter or sort owned decorations and items:
Further enabling the distraction because you have to scroll around to find what you want or are missing. More time shopping and scrolling means less time focusing unless you can ignore it. I cannot for I am a distractable goose. 

No ability to favourite or wishlist items: 
Same idea as the above. Wasting time scrolling and shopping.

Limited number of presets:
Give me more!! At least one preset for each Scenery configuration please!

Can't copy presets:
You start with the defaults each time. Kind of annoying if I want to create a different character based off of a copy of my original character with the eyes, hair colour, etc but different clothes and I have to start everything from scratch.

NO PYJAMAS:
How are there slippers but no obvious PJs or sleeping caps???

So I've came across this game since Im trying to find some cozy game that I could get here in steam. I like how well they made this, since I like character creation in games. If you are considering this game at all just go ahead and get it, tis cute fun and very easy to enjoy

Great game to leave running while actually doing stuff. I am struggeling with starting tasks and sticking to them and to be honest: This game helps. It motivates and gives me the gamification and rewards I need to keep doing my tasks and not postponing them. So thank you for making this.

You can select between different acitivites your character is doing and earn XP each minute. From this you can purchase clothes and furniture to decorate your room. Some activities unlock spirits that you can select to be your partner in crime. Recommended for everyone that struggles with doing stuff and needs something rewarding to bully their brain into starting :)

One of the cosiest game I've ever played. Perfect for some background music and ambiant noise while I work, I like the customization options and the spirits are adorable and fun to find.

This game is very relaxing, and it helped me a lot with my studies. Bonus points for the cuteness.
Great game! I enjoy finding the spirits, customizing my character and decorating my room. I love the sounds and music.

Great for studying. I can study for 20+ hours without fatigue.

Things I wish were added:
1. Ability to make the timer bigger, maybe where the 00:00 is the main focus and HUGE with transparent background (dragging the window larger keeps the font the same size, just spaces things out -- I wish the font was bigger)

All in all amazing product, highly recommend to students
Very useful study tool with cute spirits to pet. And the game gets updated a regularly with free and paid DLC making you come back for more.

After years trying to find a good productivity software (and even thinking about doing it myself) I've found Spirit City and it brings so much warm to my heart that I can be productive and relaxed at the same time.

If you're in need of an amazing software for productivity purposes or only background noises, this is the one.

negative.review:
It's hard to write the review for this amazing app. Mostly because me and devs have different view on what should give the XP. 
You see, the main bulk of xp you can get from 3 daily acts: daily login, daily timer and daily task. One task, only one task. Even if you've finished 2, 3 or more tasks or timers -- it doesn't matter. After initial daily acts you can only get xp from staying online or luring a spirit (and they are level bound). And this unfortunately doesn't help with gamification or motivation in my case. 
I would also add that new UI from 17-11-2025 Update kind of ruined the UI for me, but it's design and tastes differ. 

However, in other aspects the game has lots of pros: 
- The customization for Avatar, Spritis and the room is extensive and nice. 
- In-game coins are easy enough to obtain.
- Luring system is kind of fun.
- Wide-range options for tracking your tasks and habits. (I really like the Productivity History) 
So, in the end, the app is cool, it's just not about the habit of doing lots of tasks per day.

Don't get me wrong, the game (if you can call it a game) is very cute and probably helpful to some people. It has a todo list, habits list, pomodoro timer, a journal and an avatar you can customize along with her room. Oh, and also some spirits to "catch".

I found it very underwhelming, though. The included productivity tools are very basic, with a clunky interface, and lacking any connectivity to external tools, e.g. to Google Calendar, Todoist or Notion. Which hobbles them something awful. There isn't even any kind of data export available. Anything you do is locked and contained inside this little Steam "game".

And the cutesy visuals get old quite fast as there is nothing to do in this "game" other than putting your avatar in one of a few predetermined locations doing one of the couple activities assigned to that location. Just a continuous animation loop and that's it. Oh wait, if you pick a specific combination of location, activity, time of the day and background sounds you can unlock a cute spirit pet by letting the "game" run in the background for some time. By the way, the pets do nothing except sitting besides your avatar. You can pet them, I guess.

Don't be misled by my hours of "playtime" - I'm leaving the "game" running while AFK to grind the time-based exp bar and get to level 50 so I can tick off all achievements. As soon as I get there, I'm uninstalling.

Bottom line: don't buy this, not even on a sale. Get real productivity tools instead and watch some anime for your cuteness fix. This "game" is a noob trap.

Awful performance, you cannot do computationally demanding work while this is open.

I hate this game for continually adding achievements.

I'm leaving this as a "not recommended" due to its limitations. While the art style isn't a factor in my review, the list function is severely restricted. It only allows five entries, shrinking them unreadably as you add more unless you resize the window. A simple dropdown box for selecting and adding lists would solve this, expanding the space indefinitely. Timers are also limited, requiring manual time setting for each. The lack of profiles, which could use dropdowns to create unlimited options for different tasks, is baffling. This is supposed to be a focus app, but I'm spending too much time manually adjusting settings. As a game developer learning, I'm juggling multiple projects; it would be great to pre-set checks, goals, and habits without limits, so I can boot the game, select a profile, and work, spending less time configuring things. Isn't this supposed to be a focus app/game? Also, why can't we use voice-to-text in the journal? Finally, there's no export option for your sheets, so you risk losing everything if your save is corrupted. Good concept, poorly implemented.

Cannot in good faith recommend this game.  While it does have some good features and works if this type of thing is for you, its the Devs themselves that make this suck.

They do not listen to player Feedback. Many have asked for different QoL improvements only to be met with more and more cosmetics. When they do listen, it is only once per yearly update.

Also, be warned, there is spiders in this game. There is no way to not see it (or them if you get the DLCs) and the devs ignore any feedback about it and have since launch.
